pageContext.claim: “We have tens of thousands of people. There's never been this. You know, Ronald Reagan was great. I thought he was a great guy, great President, didn't like his policy trade, that's OK, trade, but if he came to Las Vegas, you know, they'd have a ballroom. They'd have five hundred, maybe a thousand people.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump loves to compare himself favorably to Reagan. But Reagan got big crowds -- more larger than 500 or 1,000 people. "[Wayne] Newton and [Bob] Goulet, student bands and variety acts kept the crowd of about 7,000 entertained in the saucer-shaped rotunda until Reagan arrived for a brief appearance," the UPI reported on a 1982 Reagan campaign rally.
